Clownish: Why aren't there contact circuses? Where can you pet aerial gymnasts and feed acrobats?
Why did the clown throw his watch out the window? He wanted to see time fly!
An experienced clown on call will cheer up kids, won't disappoint single moms...
Verbal: Why, when I gave my girlfriend skincare product, she doesn't leave?
The lion's share of tourists didn't return home due to a safari incident.

- What do you call someone who sold their liver?
- Well-off.
Absurdist:
Yesterday my slipper filed for marriage with a vacuum cleaner.
It said: 'It's the only one that sucks me in!'

Why do socks always get lost in the washing machine?
Because they're looking for a pair in another dimension!

My sandwich fell butter-side down.
It was a gravity conspiracy!
Ironic:
- Could you make me coffee with foam?
- Easy peasy.
Incident in Rostov. A killer sneezed, and police are still racking their brains over who could have ordered the shawarma seller...
Family news. Tolik named his son Euro. Hopes he'll grow faster...
VerbalGag: Why doesn't a mushroom go to school? They're waiting for it to *grow up*!

— Doctor, I feel like a dog!
— How old?
— Three months.
The best medicine is when they don't bill you!
IronicGag: Oh, you'll definitely recover... just like my chances for a bonus.
Laughter is the best medicine? Then where's my prescription for 'laughter'?
You're healthy!.. Just kidding. But it would be funny, wouldn't it?

Angry: Give me another doctor, this one is some kind of idiot!
I'll report you to the commission!
Neutral: Doctor, what was that just now?
I don't get what the joke is?
BossFail: One more joke like that and you're fired!

StaircaseNotCured: Cannot go to the next floor until all patients are cured. Remaining: {count}
First cure all patients on this floor. Remaining: {count}
Next floor is only available after curing all patients. Remaining: {count}
StaircaseNotVisited: Cannot go to the next floor until all wards are visited
First visit all wards on this floor
Visit all wards before going to the next floor

BatmanIntro: Welcome to our clinic, doctor! Patients are waiting for your help.
Remember: laughter is the best medicine. But not all jokes work for all patients.
Good luck, doctor! The hospital is in your hands.
BatmanOutro: Patients have recovered thanks to you.
Hints: Study the patient's medical card before choosing a joke.
Some types of humor may be forbidden for certain patients.
The higher the joke level, the greater the chance of success even with the wrong type.
Tutorial: Hello, intern! You are our last hope in fight against sadness!
Patients here are treated in only one way - with laughter. Yes, seriously!
Go to any ward, open card and find the key to this person's humor.
Choose the right gag - and the patient will recover! If you guess wrong - it will only get worse.
You can make no more than 3 mistakes on each floor. Make a 4th mistake and you're fired, rookie!
And now - forward! The hospital won't heal itself... although, who knows?

Diagnoses: Absolute Aura of Seriousness (immune to single gags)
Anamnesis: Yesterday laughed at the 'Toilet' sign on the dining room door.
Says that the moon is a light bulb someone forgot to turn off.
Says that clouds are cotton that gods forgot to clean up.
Says that the funniest thing is when someone trips over air.
Says: Laughter is a mistake of the nervous system.
Makes faces looking at the washstand mirror.
His smile is when he raises his eyebrow by 0.1 mm.
When shown a balloon, asked: Does it heal too?
When offered a joke, replied: Yeah, really funny... like my salary.
Calls the first aid kit 'first aid for dummies'
Hasn't laughed even once in 37 years.
But... there's a plush cat in glasses in his office.
Refused medicine: If I get better, who will laugh at your salaries?
Refuses to believe that doctors are not actors.
Constantly asks: Have you heard the joke about the mother-in-law and the fridge?
Tried to portray a clown using cotton swabs.
Tried to send a telegram to the past via microwave.
Tried to figure out how to say BREAD in alien language.
Tried to feed a flower soup from the TV.
Tried to write a poem where every word starts with X.
Tried to repeat falling from a stool, but fell unsuccessfully.
Tried to figure out how the word RAINBOW sounds backwards.
Tried to do a somersault on the bed, but got stuck in the curtain.
Said that a real hospital is IKEA without an exit
Said: Laughter is the best medicine? Then I want a prescription for Laughter
Laughs when you say Hippopotamus instead of Hippo.
Laughs when someone stumbles on the doorframe.
Laughs when someone sneezes loudly.
Laughs when you call a spoon 'a fork for soup'.
Watches videos of people falling and giggles.
Smiled when the nurse dropped a tray with plates.
Claims his slipper is a spy from the future.
Claims her cat controls the weather by blinking.
Quotes 90s commercials: Pelmeni - not life, but a song!
